title: Srimad Bhagavatam - Canto 1 Chapter 2 | Kids Quiz (15Q)

questions.prompt: According to SB 1.2.2, what is the real test of a good spiritual teacher?
choices: He knows how to read many books
He can cure his students from material disease like lust and anger
He is very old and famous
He lives in a big temple
questions.feedback: A real spiritual teacher helps us become free from bad things like greed and anger! That's the most important thing, not just knowing lots of facts.

questions.prompt: What happens when we keep hearing about Lord Krishna (SB 1.2.3)?
choices: Nothing happens unless we also do magic rituals
Devotional service grows in our heart and material desires slowly go away
We instantly become perfect
We get rich and famous
questions.feedback: When we keep hearing about Krishna, love for Him grows in our hearts and bad desires slowly disappear! It's like taking medicine—it works gradually if we keep taking it.

questions.prompt: According to SB 1.2.6, what is the highest dharma (duty) for everyone?
choices: Making lots of money
Becoming famous
That which leads to pure devotional service to Krishna without stopping
Just following rules perfectly
questions.feedback: The highest duty is loving devotional service to Krishna! It's not just about following rules—it's about loving God with all our heart.

questions.prompt: What should someone who wants liberation do, according to SB 1.2.7?
choices: Give up all activities and go to the forest
Inquire about the Absolute Truth from someone who knows it
Do many difficult exercises
Collect lots of holy water
questions.feedback: We should ask questions about Krishna from someone who really knows Him! Learning from a real teacher is the most important thing we can do.

questions.prompt: According to SB 1.2.8, what three things happen when we hear and chant about the Lord?
choices: We get sick, tired, and confused
The knot in our heart is cut, doubts are cleared, and karma is stopped
We become invisible, fly, and read minds
Nothing happens at all
questions.feedback: Hearing and chanting about Krishna does three amazing things: cuts the false ego, clears our doubts, and stops bad karma! This is the complete cure for material disease.

questions.prompt: What does 'unmotivated devotional service' mean in SB 1.2.9?
choices: Being lazy and not serving properly
Serving Krishna without wanting anything in return—not even liberation
Serving only when we feel like it
Not caring about Krishna at all
questions.feedback: Unmotivated means we serve Krishna just because we love Him, not to get anything! Real love doesn't ask, 'What's in it for me?'

questions.prompt: According to SB 1.2.10, how do all our desires become satisfied?
choices: By getting everything we want from the store
By serving the Personality of Godhead with love
By sleeping all day
By ignoring all our desires
questions.feedback: When we serve Krishna, all our real desires are satisfied! Our heart is happy when we do what we're meant to do—love and serve God.

questions.prompt: SB 1.2.11 says learned people call the Absolute Truth by three names. Which are they?
choices: Brahman, Paramatma, and Bhagavan
Sun, Moon, and Stars
Earth, Water, and Fire
Past, Present, and Future
questions.feedback: The Absolute Truth has three features: Brahman (the light everywhere), Paramatma (God in everyone's heart), and Bhagavan (God as a person)! All three are the same one God.

questions.prompt: Who should we learn about God from, according to SB 1.2.12?
choices: From anyone who talks about religion
From someone who has actually seen the truth (tattva-darsi)
From books alone without a teacher
From our imagination
questions.feedback: We should learn from someone who has really experienced Krishna! Just like we learn swimming from someone who can actually swim, not just read about it.

questions.prompt: What does SB 1.2.17 say we need to hear about Krishna?
choices: A college degree
Lots of money
A faithful heart (sraddha)
Magic powers
questions.feedback: We need faith in our heart! When we have faith and trust, we can hear properly and Krishna will reveal Himself to us.

questions.prompt: According to SB 1.2.18, when we regularly hear about Krishna with faith, what does He do?
choices: He ignores us
He sits in our heart and cuts away material desires and doubts
He gives us lots of toys
He makes us famous
questions.feedback: Krishna comes and sits in our heart! He then cleans out all the bad desires like we clean our room. He helps us become pure.

questions.prompt: What does devotional service free us from, according to SB 1.2.19?
choices: Homework and chores
Passion and ignorance, so we become peaceful and happy
Our parents and teachers
All rules and duties
questions.feedback: Bhakti frees us from passion (always wanting more) and ignorance (confusion)! We become peaceful, happy, and fixed in goodness.

questions.prompt: According to SB 1.2.24, what is the right order for spiritual progress?
choices: First give up everything, then start loving Krishna
First hear about Krishna, develop love for Him, then detachment from material things comes naturally
First become rich, then think about Krishna
First renounce the world, then hear about God
questions.feedback: First we hear about Krishna and start loving Him! Then we naturally lose interest in material things because Krishna is so much better. It's like when you get a great new toy, you forget about the old broken ones.

questions.prompt: Why should we maintain our body, according to SB 1.2.26?
choices: To eat as much as possible
To inquire about the Absolute Truth and know our relationship with God
To become the strongest person
To win competitions
questions.feedback: Our body is for learning about Krishna! We should take care of it so we can use it to understand God and serve Him, not just for eating and playing.

questions.prompt: What is the biggest mistake that devotional service fixes, according to SB 1.2.30?
choices: Making small errors in rituals
Thinking 'I am this body' and 'This belongs to me'
Forgetting to brush our teeth
Not knowing all the scriptures
questions.feedback: The biggest mistake is thinking we ARE the body and things belong to US! Devotional service teaches us we are souls, servants of Krishna, and everything belongs to Him. This solves all our problems!
